greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n>=1, 1 <= k <= n) = number of alternating anagrams on n letters (of length 2n) which are decomposable into at most k slices.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275 (first 50 rows)
Kreweras, G.; Dumont, D. , Sur les anagrammes alternés. (French) [On alternating anagrams] Discrete Math. 211 (2000), no. 1-3, 103--110. MR1735352 (2000h:05013).
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{i=1..n-k+1} A218826(i)*T(n-i, k-1) for k > 1. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 24 2020
program: A(n)={my(M=matrix(n,n)); for(n=1, n, for(k=2, n, M[n,k] = sum(i=1, n-k+1, M[i,1]*M[n-i, k-1])); M[n,1]=G(n+1)-sum(i=2, n, M[n,i])); M}
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 04 2014
ext: Terms a(16) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 19 2020
